remarks: Our Axiom of Choice (in the form of ~ ac3 ) implies the Axiom of Choice (first form) of [Enderton] p. 49.  The proof uses neither AC nor the Axiom of Regularity.  See ~ dfac2 for the converse (which does use the Axiom of Regularity).  (Contributed by NM, 5-Apr-2004.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
statement:
dfac2a $p |- ( A. x E. y A. z e. x ( z =/= (/) -> E! w e. z E. v e. y ( z e. v /\ w e. v ) ) -> CHOICE ) $.
$d v w x y z $.
